prerequisites: Prerequisite: Chemistry 233 and two upper division Biology courses (200 or 300-level) and instructor's permission required
summary: The course will cover the cellular and molecular biology of human skin in its normal and diseased states as it relates to a clinical presentation. Clinical dermatology and pathology will also be reviewed. The course style will be patterned along the lines as if it were a medical school course. Additionally, students will be introduced to many aspects of successfully negotiating medical school including introductions and possible "field trips" to the Mayo Clinic Medical School and/or University of Minnesota Medical School(s).
title: Human Cutaneous Biology
